name: Cofense Vision
description: This app implements investigative and generic actions to quarantine emails, manage IOCs, search messages, download messages and their attachments

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using supplied configuration
actions.verbose: The test connectivity action will first check if the Cofense Vision server is up. If the server is up and running, it will use the credentials to generate the access token. Once the token is received, it will be stored in the state file.

actions.description: Retrieves the metadata of the message that matches the specified internet message ID and recipient email address

internet_message_id.description: Unique identifier of the email, enclosed in angle brackets

actions.description: Fetches full content of an email and saves it as a zip file to the Vault

internet_message_id.description: Unique identifier of the email, enclosed in angle brackets

password.description: Password to protect the zip file

actions.description: Fetches an attachment by using its MD5 or SHA256 hash and saves it to the Vault

md5.description: Hex-encoded string that represents an attachment's MD5 hash

sha256.description: Hex-encoded string that represents an attachment's SHA256 hash

filename.description: File name including the extension to give to the file

actions.description: Fetches a list of matching quarantine jobs

page.description: Start page of the results. The value must be a positive integer or 0

size.description: Number of results per page. The value must be a positive integer up to 2000

sort.description: The name-value pair defining the order of the response. Comma separated values are supported

exclude_quarantine_emails.description: Whether to remove (true) or not remove (false) quarantined emails from the response

include_status.description: Filters quarantine jobs by including emails with the specified status. Supports comma-separated values

exclude_status.description: Filters quarantine jobs by excluding emails with the specified status. Supports comma-separated values

iocs.description: Unique MD5 hash identifier of one or more IOCs. Comma separated values are supported

sources.description: One or more configured IOC sources. Comma separated values are supported

modified_date_after.description: Emails modified after this date and time. The date and time must be in UTC

auto_quarantine.description: Whether to list only auto quarantine jobs (true) or both (false)

actions.description: Creates a new quarantine job

quarantine_emails.description: A comma-separated string of quarantine emails, specifying the recipient address and internet message ID of the email

actions.description: Restores emails quarantined by the job identified by the ID

id.description: ID of the quarantine job in cofense vision to be restored

actions.description: Retrieves the list of searches

page.description: The start page of the results. The value must be a positive integer or 0

size.description: The number of results to retrieve per page. The value must be a positive integer up to 2000

sort.description: The name-value pair defining the order of the response. Comma separated values are supported

actions.description: Retrieves the search identified by an ID

id.description: The unique ID that cofense vision has assigned to a search

actions.description: Retrieves quarantine job identified by the ID

id.description: ID of the quarantine job in cofense vision to be retrieved

example_values: No primary addresses were found for 34/xxxxx@cofense.com
Successfully retrieved the quarantine job information

actions.description: Approves the quarantine job identified by the ID. When the Auto Quarantine feature is configured to require manual approvals, this endpoint can approve the pending quarantine jobs

id.description: ID of the quarantine job in cofense vision to be approved

message_count.description: Number of emails containing IOC matches to be quarantined

example_values: The quarantine job has been approved successfully

actions.description: Deletes the quarantine job identified by the ID

id.description: ID of the quarantine job in cofense vision to be deleted

actions.description: Retrieves the results for the search identified by the search ID

id.description: The unique ID that cofense vision has assigned to a search

page.description: Start page of the results. The value must be a positive integer or 0

size.description: Number of results to fetch per page. The value must be a positive integer up to 2000

sort.description: The name-value pair defining the order of the response. Comma separated values are supported

actions.description: Deletes a single active or expired IOC from the local IOC Repository

id.description: The MD5 ID of the IOC to be deleted

source.description: A single IOC source value, to fetch the IOCs added or modified by that particular source

actions.description: Issues a request to stop the quarantine job identified by ID

id.description: ID of the quarantine job in cofense vision to be stopped

example_values: No primary addresses were found for 34/xxxxx@cofense.com

actions.description: Creates a new search based on the user-specified filters

subjects.description: A comma-separated string of subjects to create a search for an email's subject. Max 3 values are allowed

senders.description: A comma-separated string of senders to create a search for an email's sender. Max 3 values are allowed

attachment_names.description: A comma-separated string of attachment names to create a search for an email's attachments. Max 3 values are allowed

attachment_hash_match_criteria.description: The type of matching performed on the hashes specified in the attachment_hashes argument. Allowed values are ANY and ALL

attachment_hashes.description: A comma-separated string of attachment hashes to create a search for an email's attachment hashes. Supported format: hashtype1:hashvalue1. Example : md5:938c2cc0dcc05f2b68c4287040cfcf71. Max 3 values are allowed

attachment_mime_types.description: A comma-separated string of MIME types to create a search for an email's attachment MIME type. Max 3 values are allowed

attachment_exclude_mime_types.description: A comma-separated string of MIME types to create a search for excluding an email's attachment MIME type. Max 3 values are allowed

domain_match_criteria.description: The type of matching to perform on the domains specified in the domains argument. Allowed values ANY and ALL

domains.description: A comma-separated string of domains to create a search for domains in an email's body or its attachment. Max 3 values are allowed

headers.description: A comma-separated string of key-value pairs, defining the additional criteria to search for in the email header. Max 3 values are allowed

internet_message_id.description: The unique identifier of the email, enclosed in angle brackets. This argument is case-sensitive

partial_ingest.description: Whether to create a search with partially ingested emails (true) or without partially ingested emails (false)

received_after_date.description: Date and time to create a search for emails which are received on or after the specified UTC date and time

received_before_date.description: Date and time to create a search for emails which are received before or on the specified UTC date and time

recipient.description: Create a search with the specified recipient. Supports one or more wildcard characters (*) in any position of a recipient's email address

url.description: Create a search with the specified url. Supports one or more wildcard characters (*) in any position of the URL

actions.description: Retrieves the last updated IOC from the local IOC Repository. It may return an active or an expired IOC

source.description: A single IOC source value, to fetch the IOCs added or modified by that particular source

actions.description: Updates one or more IOCs stored in the local IOC repository

iocs_json.description: List of JSON data containing IOC detail to be updated in the IOC local repository

threat_value.description: Actual value of the IOC to match in the email

source_id.description: Unique identifier assigned by the IOC source

created_at.description: The UTC date and time the IOC source included the IOC for the first time

updated_at.description: The UTC date and time the IOC source last updated the IOC

requested_expiration.description: Expiration date and time for this IOC in UTC

actions.description: Updates the IOC identified by its unique MD5 ID

id.description: The ID of the IOC to be updated

expires_at.description: Expiration date and time of the IOC in UTC

actions.description: Lists the IOCs stored in the local IOC Repository

since.description: Include only IOCs that were added to the repository after the given UTC date

page.description: Start page of the results. The value must be a positive integer or 0

size.description: Number of results to fetch per page. The value must be a positive integer up to 2000

sort.description: The name-value pair defining the order of the response. Comma separated values are supported

include_expired.description: Whether to include expired IOCs (true) or not include expired IOCs (false)

actions.description: Retrieves the IOC identified by its unique MD5 ID

id.description: The MD5 ID of the IOC

source.description: A single IOC source value, to fetch the IOCs added or modified by that particular source

actions.description: Retrieves a list of configured header keys that can be used to create a message search
Downloads the log files for all Cofense Vision components
